level1.title: Variables and Data Types
level1.content:
In this stage, expect a usage of variables to store data values. 
 Common data types include integers, floats, strings, and booleans. 
 Good luck! 

 Hint: Use journal to learn about variables and data types. 
 Hint: Menu('ESC') -> Journal

level2.title: Loops and Conditionals
level2.content:
In this stage, expect to use control structures such as if-else statements and loops. 
 These structures help in making decisions and repeating actions in your code. 
 Good luck! 

 Hint: Use journal to learn about control structures. 
 Hint: Menu('ESC') -> Journal

level3.title: Array and Strings
level3.content:
In this stage, expect to work with arrays and strings. 
 Arrays are used to store multiple values in a single variable, while strings are sequences of characters. 
 Good luck! 

 Hint: Use journal to learn about arrays and strings. 
 Hint: Menu('ESC') -> Journal

level4.title: Object Oriented Programming
level4.content:
In this stage, expect to use object-oriented programming concepts such as objects and methods. 
 This approach helps in organizing code and promoting reusability. 
 Good luck! 

 Hint: Use journal to learn about object-oriented programming. 
 Hint: Menu('ESC') -> Journal

level5.title: Classes
level5.content:
In this stage, expect to create and use classes. 
 Classes are blueprints for creating objects, encapsulating data and behavior. 
 Good luck! 

 Hint: Use journal to learn about classes. 
 Hint: Menu('ESC') -> Journal
